m_szDocTitle: Mechanic develops car that uses water as fuel - BT
m_szDocSumamry: Diesel prices may have just dropped to under £1 a litre , but a car mechanic has created a vehicle that costs just 2p a litre to run. Mohammed Raees Markani has developed a car that doesn’t need diesel or petrol. It includes a modified engine that works using a combination of water and calcium carbide, which creates acetylene gas when combined. As well as being incredibly cheap to run, the vehicle is kinder to the environment. Markani, from Madhya Pradesh in India, spent five years developing the idea.
